content:
Diagnosis:		Prostate adenocarcinoma

Management:		Radical prostatectomy March 2023

Histology:		pT2c N0 Gleason 3+4=7 adenocarcinoma
		Margins negative
		Initial PSA 8.4

Current situation:	Routine follow-up

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up today. He has made an excellent recovery from his radical prostatectomy performed in March 2023. His urinary continence has continued to improve and he now requires only one pad per day. Erectile function is gradually recovering with the help of tadalafil. His latest PSA from last week is <0.01, showing no evidence of biochemical recurrence. Clinical examination today was unremarkable. He will continue with 3-monthly PSA monitoring and I will review him again in clinic in 6 months' time.

cancer_timeline.value: PSA <0.01, showing no evidence of biochemical recurrence

patient_facts.value: Requires one pad per day for urinary continence
Erectile function gradually recovering with tadalafil

status_updates.value: Post-prostatectomy patient with excellent recovery and no evidence of recurrence. Gradually improving functional outcomes.
PSA undetectable at <0.01, indicating good disease control
Improved urinary continence requiring only one pad per day
